description:
"Thank you for being a friend." Go on a sassy, retro adventure with some of your favorite Golden Girls in the ultimate Pop! battle.

In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in exciting game scenarios.

Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system—the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again—so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for the different game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game: Golden Girls #GG100 is a stand-alone game that features:

     Unique playable characters, including Rose Nylund and Blanche Devereaux
     Memorable locations to explore, including The Golden Girls' Home and the Florida Boardwalk
     Cheesecake Item to enhance your team
     The ability to combine these figures with other Funkoverse titles to create the ultimate dream team

In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Use your characters' unique abilities to gain points and achieve victory!

Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for all four game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game: Harry Potter 2-Pack is a standalone game that includes the characters Ron Weasley and Draco Malfoy. This set may be combined with others, giving you the ability to assemble the team you want!

In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Use your characters' unique abilities to gain points and achieve victory!

Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for all four game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game: DC Comics 101 is a standalone game that includes the characters Robin and Catwoman. This set may be combined with others, giving you the ability to assemble the team you want!

A tenacious Farmer against a herd of Pigs greedy for pumpkins. Who will win?

Bite the pumpkin! is an asymmetrical abstract game for two (or three) players. Each player moves in a different way: while the Farmer just plants a new pumpkin every turn, the Herd of Pigs eats pumpkins and rushes in a chosen direction, until an obstacle is found.

Each player has its own goal: the Farmer wins if he manages to plant all of his 20 Pumpkins, while the Herd of Pigs wins eating Pumpkins until the board contains 2 or less of them.

—description from the publisher

A 2-players card-placement micro game, only 20 cards.

Every card is consist of 6 squares, and there'll be 3 kinds activities on the card. The activities are the elements consist a life of miniversity student, which are Studying, Dating, Travelling, Part-time jobs and Hanging out with friends! You need to arrange your TIME efficiently to get better memories during all these activities.

Players each places 10 cards into their own placing zone in real time until each player has placed all their cards in their placing zone, then proceed to scoring points. The player who placed all cards faster get bonus points.

Placing rule:
You only need to overlap the previous card you just played, at least one square. It's no matter how many squares you covered, it's also fine to overlap whole card. It's free to cover any icons, you don't have to stack the same icon in the same position.

Scoring rule:
In Short game, check your 3 biggest blocks, you scoring 1 point for each icon in these blocks. The faster playing get 3 bonus points.

In Full game, check your biggest blocks in each kind of icon, you scoring 1 point for each icon in these blocks. Players get bonus points according to the speed rank.

-description from publisher

Your stomach sinks as space-time warps around you. For an instant you are everywhere at once, infinite, then it's back to your tiny, cramped body. Yet, you are no longer where you were a moment before; you have arrived at a new space.

Having exhausted its one-shot fuel, your Gateship Warpcore powers down. You are now by yourself in a virgin solar system, unimaginably far away from Cradle System Sol; a single Executor, with terminal authority over your cargo of a thousand intrepid colonists.

Of course, you are not alone. The Joint Assets & Colonial Operations Bureau (JACOB) rarely works without multiple levels of redundancy. Others have warped in with you; other players in the game of conflict and colonisation in deep space. You may choose to work with or against them. Will you form Alliances, or go for each other's jugulars from day one. There need not be one winner of the coveted Colonial Contract after all... but the fewer, the richer.

Think now... and think well - First things first:

You know the worlds; you have the probe data. Exploring them should reveal strategic sectors, key resources and unique secrets. Terraforming is always a useful tool, but do you really need to spend valuable resources on it? Once you have enough materials, you must start building - small outposts at first; and later on, larger settlements to suit your Faction's ideals. You must also full-body-print more colonists from personas downloaded through your ansibles - a weird kind of immigration.

Build, conquer or destroy - your fame or infamy will attract more immigrants. More people mean more expertise and influence. Now you can truly start to weave your destiny: War, Invasion, Espionage, Sabotage, Crime, Culture, Technology, Industry, Commerce, Politics, World-Building... What is going to be your game?

Your choice, Executor. Let's begin!

---

Solar Ocean: Colonies is a 4X tabletop game and companion RPG about Conflict and Colonisation in Deep Space.

We are using digital asset sales as a unique way to fund game development. Please visit the game website for more details.

Cheers is a board game focused on the social aspects of party games. It is a new concept targeting 16-25 years old people who enjoy having fun and partying. The game has many questions and challenges and thereby guarantees inappropriate but fun situations to occur.

Cheers is a board game with a new groundbreaking concept. We have gathered a selection of the most popular pre-party games in one, so you can focus on having fun.

Cheers - be the best host!

—description from the designer

Promotional game made in 1974 by Flora Soft Margarine. Cashing in on the World Cup Finals that year.

Have fun with this Goal-wall-Game!

You have often seen the big football stars shooting at the goal. Now you can try your luck yourself and become the top scorer of your family.

Game: Flick a counter three times at the bottom hole and three times at the highest hole.

The one who scores the most goals has won and that does not necessarily have to be the family football fan.

But do not forget that having a real ball game is just as much fun and a lot of health.

—user summary

The shadows arrived on the moon. From that day on, a mass of shadows (called Sheol) similar to a black tide began to form until it shrouded the moon completely and the moon "cried" the shadows down to Earth. Although technologically advanced, people had no means to stop the shadows, which slowly filled the Earth and exterminated almost all of mankind. The planet was fully enveloped in layer of clouds so dark that sunlight could not filter through and the survivors took refuge on the Isle of Light, also called the Citadel, the last outpost of mankind. In fact, Lux, a type of light radiation capable of destroying shadows, was discovered too late.

Enclosed between the immense walls that surround the many square kilometers in which the intricate levels of the citadel arise, humans have slowly forgotten the external world shrouded in darkness and exhausted themselves in a series of internal political, cultural and economic struggles. In fact, over the decades, the citadel has become a collection of decadent people, mixing nanotechnology with superstition, millenary beliefs with cyber-empowerments, chaos and the emergence of new castes.

Only the Scouts, explorers of the unknown and raiders of the outside world, have not forgotten that the world belongs to mankind and that mankind shall reclaim it one day. In this game, you are one of them.is set in a not-too-distant future. After the Moon's Weeping, Earth has turned from being the realm of man to a place reigned by shadows. The only bastion of salvation is the Citadel, where the last survivors of humanity found shelter to survive. It is from here that the Scouts head out to explore the desolate lands of Sheol in search of resources.

Sheol is a cooperative game, playable solo or up to 4 people, with an emphasis on storytelling and strategy. Sheol is set in a coherent universe where game mechanics and setting are deeply interconnected. It is organized in campaigns, in turn, subdivided into missions. In each mission, players will have to coordinate their efforts tactically to complete the objectives and defend the central game area (the Citadel) from the enemy invasion. The story will progress, mission after mission, allowing characters to discover the secrets of the Sheol’s world and unlock more items and skills.

—description from the publisher

' Faerie Chess'  is a new take on Chess, featuring both the classic Chess units and 14 new unit types with new abilities/movements.  The game offers a 2 in 1 experience, in that it contains all of the components for a classic Chess game, and the new components for Faerie Chess.

The new units added to the game include:  Soldier, Chamberlain, Peasant, Tower, Catapult, Herald, Lancer, Courtesan, Thief, Pontiff, Inquisitor, Jester, Regent, Mercenary.

Included in the game are a deck of cards to illustrate each unit's movement pattern, to aid both beginners to Chess and the new game variant material.

This is "Stiiki-World" a nice, colored, sferic wolrd, "Stiiked" in one word. 
It was habitated by life-forming called "Stiiki".
The "Stiiki" was advanced up to beeing perfect creatures, amazing warriors, able archers and powerfull mages, everybodys with an unperfect genetic problem: Huge EGO.
Stiikis always been in fight, everyone think to be the best.
To exceed their limits Stiiki had learn to channel their EGO and turn it into unique skills.
Ok, we have 2 news.... the good one:
KING STIIK it was only one Stiik be able to peacekeeping and make an alleance called "Stiiki-Squad", with his huge and high-sounding EGO; this Stiiki-Squad was made-up with megalomaniac and boastful Stiiki never seen in Stiiki-World.
This Stiiki-Squad bring peace and order in all Stiiki-World.
The life expentacy of a Stiik is 30 minutes it's mean that the badly news is: 
King Stiik is just died.

YOU HAVE TO RUN!
MAKE YOUR STIIKI-SQUAD, FACE OTHER MASTER-STIIK, GAIN THE  KING-STIIK TITLE, BRING PEACE AND ORDER INTO STIIKI-WORLD!

Stiiki-World is tactical turn based game, totally sand-box for maps even for gameplay mode. 
Many playable characters with uniques skills.
Very simple to learn but hardest to master it! 
Few rules, extremely well balanced but it's tactical nature make in love pro-gamer and newbies.

—description from the designer

La Garde 6mm: Rules for Napoleonic grand tactical battles in 6mm.

The concept is to give "grand order". That is to give orders to corps & divisional commanders, not to order a single battalion.
It is considered that a divisional or brigade commander ordered to take defensive positions will form his troops in square by himself if the need was to arise ...

An original system with tokens is used to resolve combats. 
Dice are used to determine reinforcements entry times and duration of the battle.

The goal is to break the enemy morale, not just inflicting casualties.

Turn order sequence:

     Preparation phases


- Reinforcement phase
- Order phase
- Rally and officers replacement phase
- Initiative phase
- Army corps orders Disclosure


     Activation Cycle:


- Activation phase
- Orders disclosure
- Movements and combats


     Consolidation Phase


Game scale for ~6mm figures:
1cm = 20 meters.
3cm = 60 meters (width of the bases)
10cm = 200 meters (effective range of muskets)
60cm = 1200 meters (max range of 12 pounds of artillery pieces)
1m = 2km
A game turn last from 20 to 55 minutes.

- User summary

This is re-build edition of Lion of Sinai

This is a war simulation game talked about Yom Kippur War in 1973

Theme:
Foodie Frenzy is a fast and funny game for 3–6 players that combines dice rolling and card play. Players compete to be the first to serve the customer's order without having any LOLcats spoiling it. Success requires tactical thinking and willingness to seize opportunities, as well as quick reflexes.

Gameplay:

     Collect all the Dishes that are listed on the Order card on your Platter to win the round. 
     But it won't be that easy, though. Other players can use LOLcats cards to prevent you from delivering your meal!
     They can also spoil your Platter by placing useless cards on it!
     Be ready to grab the Kikker when the dice roll shows 2 or 3 of a kind!
     Whoever holds the Kikker gets a Bonus card for extra moves, and their Platter can’t be spoiled on that turn.


Goal:
Be the first to complete the order and cash-in the money.

—description from the designer

Runeatic Chambers is a cooperative dungeon exploration game for 1 to 2 players. Players aim to collect specific amount of Runes to proceed to the lower levels of the dungeon. If you successfully reached the deepest level, you win the game. However, if you received too much damage or too many phobias, you lose the game.

The game is composed by cards as a dungeon tile, a die for monster fights.

—description from the publisher
' European theater: 1941 - 1945' ï¼ˆå†³æˆ˜æ¬§é™†ï¼‰ is a simulation on the the land combat in Europe from 1941 to 1945. The game also has system focus on Submarine warfare, and Technology upgrading.

Scott Pilgrim Miniatures the World! is a competitive board game where one team takes on the role of Scott and the other good guys to fight against The League of Evil Exes. The action takes place on a pop-up board with large miniatures, custom dice, and 3D constructible objects for smashing and throwing!

In this miniatures combat game, you'll go head to head either as Scott and his friends or as an Evil Ex. You'll roll dice and take actions including: moving, using a basic attack (punching or kicking), recovering health, picking up and throwing objects, or using one of a character's special abilities pulled right from the pages of the Scott Pilgrim graphic novels.

Deal damage to your opponent and knock them out by reducing them to 0 health. Scott and his friends win if they knock out the Evil Ex, but they'll have quite the challenge! The Bad Guys win if all the Good Guys are knocked out.

—description from the publisher

A roll-and move game about a mole that wants to find who did a dump on its head. It features the Little Mole, the butchers dog Hans-Heinerich, and other animals from the childrens book classic.

In turn, the player rolls a die and moves his pawn forward, according to the result. There are some animal spaces; landing on them provides a shortcut. Other spaces contain dog droppings; if you collect two of them, you have to skip a turn to clean your feet.

The first player who reachs the dog at the end of the track wins the game.

—user summary

In Bloqueo, a turn always consists of three steps:


     Move a game figure at least two spaces,
     Place one of your octagons, and
     Put two blocking pieces on this octagon.


Turn after turn, more and more spaces are occupied with octagonal pieces. In the best case, you connect these spaces into groups – provided that the spaces are orthogonally adjacent. If you even manage to have a high tower as part of a large group, you can definitely score many points.

These towers may grow up to four levels; at the scoring, they serve as a multiplier. The color of the octagon on top determines who scores for this tower.

It can be difficult at times to decide which game figure to move, which of your octagons to protect, and which tower to conquer, but these decisions make the game interesting and demanding.

—description from the publisher

A cooperative game of wordless communication
You and your partner must arrange the colored symbols so you both win. But neither of you knows what the other needs! Your only communication is a card that can mean four different things. You must read your partner’s mind to understand what they want. If you misread them, you will both lose. To win you must both be Telepathic!

Gameplay
Telepathic is a cooperative two-player game in which you must communicate without speaking or gesturing. You and your partner each have one secret win condition and one secret lose condition. You must arrange a grid of tiles so that it simultaneously matches both partners’ win conditions. When you believe you have done so, you must each announce each other’s win condition. You lose if either of you announce the wrong win condition, or if the grid ever matches either partner’s lose condition.

The rulebook also includes rules for a 3+ player mode, a 4 player mode, and 2v2 team competitive play.

(text from the game's online description from The Game Crafter)

Scarty is a card game on the world of waste and, in particular, on that of recycling. The game (for 2-8 players) has simple rules, is also suitable for children (ages 6 and up) and includes a strategy aimed not only at acquiring personal points but also at blocking the game of the opponents. The aim of the game is to discard all the cards first, that is, to remain without cards in hand.
The cards can be discarded by putting each waste in the right dumpster but only if the right dumpster has been put on the table before. There are also some waste cards that can pollute and block a dumpster. In that case, only cards with a 4R (Recycle) process can unblock pollute dumpsters. Some special waste can seriously pollute the environment so that if played they will penalize the player by forcing him to draft three more cards from the deck; as an additional effect, all players should pass a card to the relative player on their left.

Hidden roles bluffing game set in the Netflix series "La Casa de Papel". Some players are the thiefs trying to print enough money before the fifth round, and some are the hostages sabotaging the machines with help from a police inspector who is trying to unmask the mastermind.

—user summary

¡Tras las máscaras, todos los engaños están permitidos!

En el interior de la Real Casa de la Moneda unos atracadores vestidos con monos rojos y máscaras de Dalí llevan a cabo el plan elaborado por el Profesor: imprimir 2400 millones de euros y luego escapar con ellos ante las mismas narices de la policía que rodea el edificio. ¡Pero los rehenes deciden rebelarse! Raquel Murillo, inspectora de policía, solo tiene una cosa en mente: desenmascarar el cerebro de la operación.

En este juego de faroleo e identidades secretas, dos equipos se enfrentan en 5 rondas para alcanzar su objetivo. Los ladrones, ayudados por el Profesor, intentarán imprimir cierta cantidad de dinero antes de la 5ª ronda. Los rehenes, ayudados por Raquel Murillo, deben evitarlo saboteando las máquinas que imprimen los billetes.

—description from the publisher

Hey Robot is a party game where two teams compete to get a smart speaker (like Alexa or Google Home) to say specific words. It can be played by any group size, from 2 players to as many as you can fit around a table.

You start the game by laying out a 4x4 grid of word cards. Cards have a point value from 1 to 3. Teams take turns trying to capture one of the cards by asking the speaker a single question, without using any form of the word on the card. If the speaker says the word in its response, the team captures that card and scores the points.

Whenever a team misses with their question, they must add a bonus point token to the card, increasing its value. Whenever a team captures a card, they add a bonus point token to any of the cards next to the captured card. The first team to score 16 points wins the game.

Hey Robot rewards general knowledge, linguistic dexterity, and the ability to reverse-engineer the algorithms that power the smart devices we've brought into our homes. It's the first board game designed for humans and AI to play together.

—description from the publisher

13 Monsters is a tabletop game that requires skill, memory and just a bit of luck. Devise the perfect strategy while you collect, battle or barter for the parts you need to create your own ultimate monster. Not much of a fighter yet? Just keep searching for monster parts on the playing field but always watch your back! Other players will stop at nothing to build their own army of perfect monsters, even if it means attacking everything you’ve built so far. Will you be able to build your monsters on time to defend what’s yours and conquer your opponent? Or will your bad strategy cost you an arm and a leg?

—description from the designer

Each player starts at one of five starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die. The players have to visit 8 cities and return to their starting space. At each city, the player collects a colored cardboard ring to stack on his playing peace. The first player to return to his starting space with eight collected rings wins the game.

—user summary

A Dia de Muertos themed dice rolling game for 2-5 players.

It's the Day of the Dead and players take the roles of friendly spirits guiding souls from Mictlán, the world of the dead, to the land of the living. The first player to guide souls up the 9 levels back to the land of the living is the winner.

To do this players will choose, maniplulate and roll caskets containing dice representing souls. They will have Candles, Incense, Marigolds and the Bread of the Dead to help them, but need to hope for a little luck.

Die of the Dead has beautiful Mexican art inspired by the tales and culture surrounding Dia de Muertos. Care has been taken to make the game as fun as possible whilst staying respectful to its roots.

—description from the designer

Talenticity - The Art-Battle with Visual Magic!
A competitive tactical 2-4 players board game in which players compete for territory, make Moneye (the official currency of Talenticity), collect artifacts and become the superstar!

Talenticity is a mix of a strategy and tactical board game. Explore the Talenticity field with your hero, perform, run shows and conquer the city. And meanwhile: watch out for other artists, they want this city too!

The game starts with random hero and god cards distribution, each player picks a faced down card of a hero and a god.

The players receive their Hero miniatures and their performance miniatures.

Each player rolls the dices, the one with the biggest outcome starts the game. Then the order goes in a clockwise direction.

At the beginning of every day, all players take a piece of the Skies in order and use their God's eye to see the hidden image. The first player to take a piece of the Skies changes in a clockwise direction every new day. The Players should take and put the skies back one by one in a clockwise direction as well. Each player puts the Skies part back anywhere they want and tries to remember that location.

It is possible to compete in the sky too! Players can follow who saw which sky and take it to change its position on the next day.

Players' Turn:

The player takes a show card from the deck at the start of his/her turn. Each player can have only 3 show cards in hand. Each turn player can take a show card from the deck or put one show card back under the deck of shows.

The player rolls the dices and uses the Action Points*:

1 AP for movement on the board
2 AP to place a performance mini around the hero miniatures
3 AP to perform a show. 
4 AP to knock out another players performance miniature

     - The Players do not have to use all the action points that they have every turn.


The players can offer to trade or sell shows and artifact cards to other players during their turn.

To perform a show, the player has to have 3 performance miniatures around the picked location. Then the player has to show the other players the piece of the skies that gives the blessing to perform a show in this location. If the player fails to show the correct sky piece, the show is canceled. The player takes back all three performance miniatures around that location and receives no Moneye. If the show is successful, then the player receives that location card + Moneye according to the show card + any combos.

For placing a performance miniature on the playing field, the player earns 1 Moneye.

The player doubles double the Moneye earned from a show that matches the player's god.

The player gets +2 extra Moneye if he or she performs the show in a matching location.

After performing a show, if unused action points remain, the player can use them.

To receive an artifact the player must show a combination of 3 Moneye that read the artifact name.

It is not allowed to combo artifacts in one turn. Each artifact can only be used once in the game.

The game ends when one of the players performs 5 shows (6 shows for 2&3 players).

The richest player wins the Art-Battle!

Tonga Blocks is a tower building dexterity game where the player who causes the tower to fall loses.

The rule book also contains 30+2 different puzzles that can be built using the blocks of the game.

When playing TONGA Blocks, it is a good idea to agree on the rules in advance. There are many ways to play TONGA - Serene or fiery Argentinian, are you building a solid or easily falling tower, with two hands or weaker hand, can you continue the game by taking the lower pieces already laid... The pieces also go for random construction and imaginative play.

Tonga Blocks comes in a cardboard box, but the pieces are meant to be stored in the fabric bag provided.

—user summary

Node is a competitive strategy game where players compete to quickly build the best node network. A series of square cards are shuffled and laid out to form the game board, and players then place nodes on the corners, and branches on the edges of the squares.

Every node a player places on the board grants them additional resources, which can then be used to buy additional nodes and branches to further expand their network. Things quickly become tricky though, as the squares on the board can become exhausted and stop granting resources, or captured by a player.

Players accumulate points by placing nodes, capturing squares, and having the largest network, first to 10 points wins. Experienced players may also play the advanced ruleset, which is even more challenging!

—description from the publisher

"76 Hours of Hell" (76HOH) is a two-player wargame simulation that depicts the November 1943 American invasion of the Tarawa Atoll. This was the first major amphibious invasion launched in the Pacific against an entrenched enemy. 76 HOH is much more of a game than a simulation, and was developed in the spirit of the popular Avalon Hill Panzerblitz game that spawned so many variants in the 1970’s. As such, the rules are “design for effect” in an attempt to keep their length and scope to a manageable level, allowing players to fight the battle, not the rules.

In the rules, historical notes and explanations are listed in italics. Now, hit the beach!

Components: 33 x 17 map, 2 counter sheets, 18 page rule book with charts, scenarios and notes. The map layout is offered in two sizes, tabloid or letter, for the convenience of PNP.

—description from the designer

In Elf's world, all locks have a magical reset diamonds inside the lock, which could only be used by locksmith. 
During the game, players will play as Elf Locksmiths, use the magic keys in hands, through all the lock cogs and keyholes inside, to reset the lock, and save the poor Elf Sibbings the day!

The game's rundown is simple:

     Setup the Locks according to instructions;
     Put the magic key into the keyholes, and find a way to reach the reset diamonds, without destroying the lock.
     Whoever reset the lock save the day!

Werewolf's world is big, full of fabulous creatures and characters! Once up a time, they got together and organized a game night called "BINGO!"
The game is simple:

     Play as many cards as you want, as long as they can form up a formation;
     And the next player should play cards following the last player's formation;
     The last player who plays the formation wins the current round, and take all B, I, N, G, O cards among the played cards this round.
     If there is a player played out his hand cards, the game night is over, and everyone calculate their five score cards: B,I,N,G,O. 


5. The player who has the most B,I,N,G,O cards wins the game!

DIE in the Dungeon!
A solo game of DIE-namic dungeon crawling, where you are the dungeon monster!

GAME SUMMARY
You are a powerful creature, used to being in control, others in constant fear of you.  Without warning you were taken away from your lands by a spell, cast by mighty wizard that even you could not stop. Now you find yourself in an unknown dungeon, full of weaker monsters and annoying adventurers.  You decide to find your way out of this dungeon, willing to destroy anything that gets in your way.

WINNING the GAME
You win the game once you have defeated all Hero's that are in the Dungeon. 
You lose the game if, at the end of any turn, you have 0 Time, 0 Health, or a dungeon tile result states that you lose the game.

—description from the publisher

Draw West is a micro card game with bag building. The game plays several rounds, until the end game condition is met.

During player turn, the player:

     Either plays a face up card from his/ her hand to perform the ability on the card, 
     Or plays a face down card to perform one of Market actions. 


When each player plays six cards in their tableau, the round ends. Then the players determines their faction by the number of the face up cards in their tableau. If there are two factions in the end of the round, the final duel carries out. The player from each faction starts to duel by drawing cubes from their bags until there is only one faction survived and the survived players scores.

—description from the designer

“Rome doesn't reward traitors”  (puts them to rule)

Pro Roma! is  a strategy and management game in which players put themselves in the shoes of Rome senators with the goal to obtain power through their management to lead their faction to the hegemony .

To do this, first  they must fight in the Senate to obtain Charges and be able to take control of the different areas of the city management: They must be efficient enough to be recognized by the people, making the City prosper and defending it from incursions. and dangers from its borders.

There are three phases: Election, Management and Event.
In the first phase players take resource cards and they must decide which card must be used to obtain votes, votes that later will be decisive to obtain Charges through a hidden betting mechanism, Charges like the Consul, the Edil or the Tribune. The game compensates those who obtain less relevant Charges giving them more possibilities to opt to better Charges.

In the second phase players will be able to perform the actions assigned to their Charges in a established order. For which they will have the resource cards that remain in their hand. The goal is to put their counters every time he can do a successfully action.

In the last phase maybe Rome must face a raid, for which the military investment that the players have made so far can be decisive for the victory.

The game will ends when a player uses all its counters, being declared the winner. On the other hand, an automatic victory is also possible if a player must use a counter when he doesn't have  any counter in his reserve.

—description from the publisher

Six Empires is a historical strategy game with unique mechanics for world events, national morale, and non-player nations.

Each territory in the game is assigned a point value. Higher value territories give you more points, but are harder to conquer!

In addition, some territories have additional benefits like the ability to generate new military units or a port city that will benefit your economy. (But also make you more vulnerable to attack!)

The goal is to reach 30 total points worth of territories that you control, while controlling all the territories of your color, and at least one territory of another player's color.

—description from the designer

The Rival Networks is a standalone two-player version of The Networks. Much of the original's gameplay is preserved, but streamlined so that it plays in 30-45 minutes. You and your opponent each have a display of 3 Timeslots, and at the start of the game, they show your starting 3 (terrible) Shows. There is also a Goal Card showing for the current Season, with 3 Goals available to hit (like winning a particular Timeslot, or having more Stars on your Shows than your opponent).

On your turn, you will pick one new Show from a display of 3, and use it to replace one of your existing Shows, which moves to your Reruns. You'll score Ratings Points for the new Show, scoring higher ratings if you put the show in its correct timeslot.

Next, you select one Star and one Ad from their corresponding display. Stars and Ads are displayed as pairs, so when you take one, you must take its matching pair. These go into your Green Room.

Then, you may attach as many Stars as you want onto a single Show (usually the Show you got this turn, but not always), as long as the Star has an icon matching the Genre of the Show. Stars add to your Show's Ratings.

You'll track Ratings for each of the three Timeslots independently. There are various points on each Ratings track with Viewer icons (usually between 3-5 Ratings Points). Every time you pass one of these Viewer icons, you'll score a Viewer by placing a chip into your secret bank.

Ads are worth money depending on various situations - usually whether you're leading at a given Timeslot. You'll pay the Ads in order to buy Network Cards (which are now marked with costs). Network Cards are one-time use power cards, similar to the Network Cards in the original game.

If you ever get at least 3 Shows of the same Genre between your Lineup and your Reruns, you'll score a Genre Bonus. Genre Bonuses are different for each Genre, but usually get you Stars or Ratings Points.

The deck of Shows has one Genre of each Show per Season. Once these are all out, you'll see an "End of Season" card. A player may take this card on their turn to trigger the end of the Season when their turn is over. They won't get a Show, but they'll still get a full turn otherwise (taking a Star and an Ad, placing Stars on Shows, and buying Network Cards with Ads).

At the end of a Season, the player leading in more Timeslots scores 1 Viewer for each Timeslot they're leading in; the other player draws 1 random Star. Then you'll look at the current season's Goals. The winner of each Goal gets Viewers or Stars depending on the goal.

The game ends after 3 Seasons. The player with more cards in their Green Room scores 1 Viewer. Then, the player with the most Viewers wins.

Crayne: Fractured Empire is an epic, strategic, high-fantasy deck-building card game for 1-6 players, set in the world of Crayne. The game has over 100 unique high-quality illustrations and 225 cards in the base set!

In Crayne: Fractured Empire, the construction of a strong deck during gameplay is the main focus of the game. The cards provide a type of in game currency called revenue which allows players to purchase more/better cards to add to their decks which they can eventually use to overpower their opponents with relentless attacks. The game also utilities some same-time play rules, indirect combat and discard discount system, and has much depth and strategy.

Crayne: Fractured Empire features eight unique factions that the players (called Lords) can recruit to aid them in conquering the other Lords. Each faction has its own strengths and unique talents. In addition each game is played with randomized factions, which leads to many different combinations of play-styles. Lords will have to come up with a strategy on how to win on-the-fly, whilst utilizing the factions that are available for purchase and adapting to the moves of their opponents.

—description from the designer

Parrot Pair-it is a cute and easy game that people of any age can enjoy. Each deck contains beautiful artwork of 26 pairs of parrots. Each pair has its own point value based on how common the parrot species is.

There are two ways to play Parrot Pair-it:

Dexterity

For those who want a dexterity-based game, five random cards would be spread on the table, face up. Each player draws seven cards from the rest of the deck. The player whose turn it is looks for a pair. If there is on in their hand, easy points, lay them down in front of you. If they have a card in their hand that matches a card the table, they must let the parrot fly down to its mate. Hold the card at least a foot above the table, flip it up and try to get it to land, face up, touching its match. If it does, pick up it and add it to your collected pairs. If not, place it in the discard pile, draw a card, and hope you’ll do better the next try.

Simply Picking Pairs

Another way to play Parrot Pair-it is the Old Maid method, where players hold a hand of seven cards and either ask if an opponent has a card needed to make a pair, or they may physically remove a card from an opponent’s hand. Lay any pairs down to be counted later.

Scoring

Cards have a number scale across the bottom that rises from left to right. Some parrots species will only have one pair, while others may have up to five. If a player, for example, has one pair of macaws, which is a five-pair set, it may be worth only five points. But if the player has four of the five macaw pairs, they would have 25 points, and if they have all five, fifty points. Winning the game is when one person reaches a predetermined score, or when all the parrots have been paired with the person with the highest score winning.

—description from the designer

THE GIFT OF THE GAB is a unique talking game that brings a combination of humour, mental stimulation and awareness. All whilst enriching speech and cognition!

Free print & play available.

Rules


     Don’t say the filler words "um", "er/uh", "like", "you know" and "basically".
     Don’t pause for more than 3 seconds.
     Don’t repeat yourself.
     Don’t talk slowly.


Overview

30 or 60 seconds to speak off the cuff...

Describe - 'Random Stuff' cards that challenge your ability to describe with your basic senses.
Discuss - 'Topical Subject' cards that challenge your ability to discuss and share knowledge on current matters.
Answer - 'Thought Provoking Question' cards that challenge your ability to answer what you may be asked in an interview, by scary in-laws and by silly friends.
Sell -'The Unsellable' cards that challenge your ability to sell by finding the value in anything.

Have you got it?

—description from the designer

Help chef Sango prepare the tastiest Japanese “ramen” (noodle soup). Tactically select your ingredients, draw them into the different bowls and complete the customers’ orders. Are you the best sous chef?

In each of the 6 rounds, the players draw the ingredients from 2 topping cards in the 8 bowls of their score card. The players get to choose the first topping card themselves and the remaining topping card must be drawn by all the players. Draw the ingredients of the topping cards in the correct bowls in order to earn points. A bonus is awarded for a full bowl. The smartest player who earns the most points wins the game.

-description from publisher

A card game for 2-5 players that resembles Uno, Mau Mau, Prší, Crazy Eights. It's fast paced, full of twists and turns, with pretty illustrations and czech school environment names.
The game is played with a 32-card pack. The aim is to be first to get rid of all of one's cards. But- you can get more cards due opponent's actions, you can be even get back into the game even though you have no cards left - simply twists and turns.

The gods are at war with each other. But that doesn't matter to you, as you are not a god. You are a champion of your race, and your god has told you of a great relic that will provide you with immeasurable power to overcome your foes. You must gather your most fierce forces to make the journey because your enemies have the same destiny.

Divinities Boon: Primordium, pits fantasy races against each other in a battle to a magical relic. Champions command forces as they move forward on the player’s game board. Attack your opponent’s forces with melee, ranged or siege assaults to move your champion forward, or your enemy backward. Once your champion reaches the Boon, they must fight to retain control of it for three rounds. But victory is fleeting, for the other gods have the power to remove the boon and give their favored champion another chance for greatness.

Players take turns by playing one or two minions, whose MELEE, RANGED, and SIEGE stats combine. If they beat the opposing player’s minions in any of the three attacks, that champion is moved forward a number based on the cards played (attack and ranged), or the opposing champion is moved backward (siege). Champions add powerful bonuses to the minion's attacks and defenses. Boon cards may also be played to give an added edge.

Once the champion reaches the final destination, they must maintain control of the relic for three, non-consecutive rounds. The winner returns to their homeland with the favor of their god until they take it away to play their game again.

—description from the designer

For once, Sherlock Holmes' talents are required across borders. It is with his brother Mycroft, a member of the British government, that the famous detective will go from India to the United States to solve three investigations. Play as one or the other of the Holmes brothers, and find the guilty parties.

Sherlock Holmes: International is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your special abilities, your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher

Inspired by Midge Maisel's life in the Amazon Original Series, The Game of Life: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Edition board game has players seeking fame and fortune during 1950s New York City. Maybe you'll get married, have kids, buy a dream home, go on vacation in the Catskills, and make it as a stand-up comic. Then again, maybe you won't. You could get divorced, bomb at the jokes, and end up in a dumpy apartment. Choose a path and find out what life has in store for you. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins — unless someone hits it big time in comedy!

—description from the publisher

Summer, sun, sea, and a red-yellow lighthouse: Who wouldn't think of vacation?

In Lighthouse Ahoy!, each player builds their own tower, which includes the base, red and yellow disks for the tower, and the green roof. The individual components are available only with the right dice combination.

Who will have a lucky hand and get the most points?

Ruins Restorer is a solo Print and Play 18 identical cards game (ICG) designed for Button Shy September 2019 challenge.
The goal of the game is to restore as many ancient ruins as possible, before resources run out.
Game consists of 18 identical poker sized cards with different front and back, each divided in two areas - 4 ruins per card. It uses deck building mechanics, and deckbuilding is achieved through manipulation (flipping and turning)of the discard pile. Discard pile also doubles as a timer that triggers end game and scoring.

—description from the designer

Operation Compass: North Africa, December 1940 is an Operational level Solitaire board-wargame where the player primarily takes on the role of commanding the Allied forces during the first 4 days of the campaign in Egypt that saw the Italian forces forced out of that country in 1940. The Italian forces are managed by the player in accordance with the rules. The game is not designed for two players. Each hex represents 3 miles from side to side. Each turn represents half a day. Unit counters represent battalions, or Regiments/Reinforced Regiments. Playing time, typically less than two hours.

—description from the publisher
